questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

An engineer must use a Cisco ACI backup process to back up the entire data center fabric configuration. Drag and drop the configuration snippets onto the boxes to back up the configuration, including hashed secure properties to the FTP server. Not all configuration snippets are used.

//IMG//

choices.C: Access control rules for the private network are applied.
choices.D: Any changes to the underlying EPG objects are forbidden.
choices.A: Any configuration changes to the private network are validated.
choices.B: Access control rules for the L3Out network are applied.

questions.question_text:
What is the result of the pcEnPref flag configured on the epg-App_EPG?

//IMG//

discussion.content: Agree with C, private network must be (L3 out would be discarded as there is no indication in the output of being a L3out)

Selected Answer: B
To meet the requirements where contracts are pushed to the Cisco ACI leaf switches when a VM is mapped to an EPG and removed when LLDP is disabled, the following configuration must be selected:
Configuration Option: On-Demand Resolution for VMM Domain

comments.content: In Cisco ACI, Resolution Immediacy determines when the policies (such as contracts and VLAN mappings) for an endpoint group (EPG) are pushed to the leaf switches. To meet the requirement that contracts are pushed to the ACI leaf switches only when the VM is mapped to an EPG via LLDP and removed when LLDP is disabled, the Resolution Immediacy must be set to On-Demand.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: B
B. Resolution immediacy: On-Demand

This will ensure that contracts are only applied and enforced when the endpoints (VMs) are actually discovered and present, and they are removed when LLDP is disabled, reflecting the dynamic presence or absence of the endpoints.

Selected Answer: B
deployment immediacy is when policy is written to the CAM.

Swaying towards B as the answer - 

https://learnduty.com/cisco-aci/cisco-aci-resolution-and-deployment-immediacy-explained/

Selected Answer: B
On Demand: VLAN will be deployed on leaf interfaces only when:
1- Hosts are detected via LLDP/CD (basically immediate)
2- At least one VM is associated to the EPG corresponding port group.

Answer is B:
• On Demand—Specifies that a policy (for example, VLAN, VXLAN bindings, contracts, or filters) is pushed to the leaf node only when an ESXi host is attached to a DVS and a VM is placed in the port group (EPG).
The policy will be downloaded to leaf when host is added to VMM switch and virtual machine needs to be placed into port group (EPG). CDP/LLDP neighborship from host to leaf is required.

Selected Answer: C
Immediate—Specifies that EPG policies (including contracts and filters) are downloaded to the associated leaf switch software upon ESXi host attachment to a DVS. LLDP or OpFlex permissions are used to resolve
Immediate—Specifies that the policy is programmed in the hardware policy CAM as soon as the policy is downloaded in the leaf software.

On Demand—Specifies that a policy (for example, VLAN, VXLAN bindings, contracts, or filters) is pushed to the leaf node only when an ESXi host is attached to a DVS and a VM is placed in the port group (EPG).

Pre-provision—Specifies that a policy is downloaded to a leaf switch even before a VM controller is attached to the virtual switch . This pre-provisions the configuration on the switch.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/1-x/aci-fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals_chapter_01011.html

questions.question_text: An engineer must integrate a Cisco ACI fabric with VMware and discover an ESXi host using LLDP. Two EPGs have been created and associated with the VMM domain. The engineer must configure the ACI such that contracts are pushed to the ACI leaf switches when the VM is mapped to EPG and the contracts are removed when LLDP is disabled. Which configuration must be selected to meet these requirements?

choices.C: Add the UDP filter port 162 to the existing OOB contract.
choices.B: Configure the OOB contract under the common tenant.
choices.D: Provide a standard contract under the user tenant.
choices.A: Consume the inband contract from the out-of-band EPG.

questions.question_text: An engineer must monitor a Cisco ACI fabric with SNMP. The “permit any contract” attribute is not configured in the fabric. Which action must be taken to receive SNMP traps from Cisco APIC?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To monitor Cisco ACI fabric with SNMP, the APIC must be able to send SNMP traps to the external SNMP monitoring system.

SNMP traps are sent over UDP port 162.
If "permit any contract" is not configured, then explicit contracts must allow traffic from APIC to the external SNMP receiver.
The APIC out-of-band (OOB) management network is typically used for SNMP monitoring.

Selected Answer: C
Pre-requisites
1. To allow SNMP communications, you must configure an "out-of-band (OOB) contract" in the "mgmt" tenant
to allow SNMP traffic. SNMP traffic typically uses UDP port 161 for SNMP requests.
2. Configure the APIC OOB IP addresses in the "mgmt" tenant. Although the OOB addresses are configured
during APIC setup, the addresses must be explicitly configured in the "mgmt" tenant before the OOB
contract will take effect.
About SNMP
ACI provides SNMPv1, v2, and v3 support, including Management Information Bases (MIBs) and notifications (traps). The
SNMP standard allows any third-party applications that support the different MIBs to manage and monitor the ACI fabric.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/aci-guide-configuring-snmp.pdf

Selected Answer: D
EIGRP: Lower CPU and memory needs
OSPF: Memory - and CPU-intensive
https://www.catchpoint.com/dynamic-routing-protocols/eigrp-vs-ospf

Selected Answer: D
It's D, everyone know that rapid convergence with low cpu usage is EIGRP.

questions.question_text:
A network engineer is implementing a Layer 3 Out in the Cisco ACI fabric. The data center core switches must connect to a pair of leaf switches and exchange routes via a routing protocol. In addition, the implementation must meet these criteria:

• The external switch interface must use 802.1Q tagging.
• Access to the Internet for the ACI fabric must be the L3Out.
• The L3Out must use a routing protocol that has rapid convergence time and low CPU usage.

Which configuration set meets these requirements?

choices.B:
Configure the BGP Protocol policy with the appropriate Autonomous System number.
Configure an Interface policy and an External Bridged Domain.
Create an External Bridged Network and use the configured VLAN pool.
Build the Leaf profile and select the Routed sub-interface with the appropriate VLAN.
choices.C:
Implement the IS-IS Protocol policy with the selected Autonomous System number.
Create the Routed Outside object and Node Profile and select IS-IS.
Configure the Interface profile and select the Routed Interface with the appropriate interfaces.
Create the External Network object.
choices.A:
Configure the OSPF Protocol policy with an area of 0.
Set up the Routed External Network object and Node Profile and select OSPF.
Create the Switch profile and select VPC with the appropriate interfaces.
Create the default network and associate it with the Routed Outside object.
choices.D:
Implement the EIGRP Protocol policy with the selected Autonomous System number.
Create Routed Outside object and Node Profile and select EIGRP as the routing protocol.
Build the Interface profile and select SVI and the appropriate VPC.
Configure the External Network object with a network of 0.0.0.0/0.
